title: Prohibits any person who works on a regular basis for a political committee for a statewide elected office from receiving compensation from an inaugural committee
summary: Prohibits any person who works on a regular basis for a political committee for a statewide elected office from receiving compensation from an inaugural committee.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2280

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Elections

       AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to limitation  on  compen-
         sation by inauguration committees

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The election law is amended by adding a new section  14-125
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S  14-125.  LIMITATION ON COMPENSATION BY INAUGURATION COMMITTEES.  NO
    4  PERSON WHO WORKS ON A REGULAR BASIS,  EITHER  WITH  OR  WITHOUT  COMPEN-
    5  SATION,  FOR  A  POLITICAL COMMITTEE FOR A STATEWIDE ELECTED OFFICE, MAY
    6  THEREAFTER RECEIVE COMPENSATION FROM A COMMITTEE ORGANIZED TO PROMOTE OR
    7  AID IN THE INAUGURATION OF THE  STATEWIDE  ELECTED  OFFICIAL  FOR  WHOSE
    8  COMMITTEE SUCH PERSON WORKED.
    9    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07052-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to limitation on compensation by inauguration committees
